item.description:
Dear Enthusiastic Boston Volunteers,

This is an outdoor event, our efforts will focus on planting daffodil bulbs on Little Greenough Blvd, Watertown. Using  shovels, pick axes, and other hand tools we will dig trenches, prep the soil, and plant upwards of a few hundred daffodil bulbs. We will cover the bulbs and clean up the site as we wait for springtime flower blossoms. We will be in close proximity to lots of soil. Please be prepared for the event by wearing clothes you do not mind getting dirty – as that is half the fun!

Here is the link to google Maps which shows the clear location of the Conservancy Truck:

http://goo.gl/maps/iwdvG

Driving Directions: I recommend to put 640 Arsenal Street,Watertown, MA 02472 on your GPS, after arriving there, Take the 1st right onto Greenough Blvd, Parking Lot is on the left. Look for the Conservancy Truck Parked there by the bike trail.

Commuting Directions from Boston: Take Redline towards Alewife, get off at Harvard Square Station, Take Bus # 70 towards Cedarwood via Watertown & Waltham, get off at Western Ave @ Soldiers Field Rd. Walk west on Western Ave toward Leo M Birmingham Pkwy, continue onto N Arsenal St,  Slight left onto Dr Paul Dudley White Bike Path. Look for the Conservancy Truck Parked there by the bike trail.

https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=215645647937057345495.0004cd48d917604a92f11&msa=0&ll=42.36254,-71.130638&spn=0.046423,0.086946

Date/Time: 11-Nov-12, Sunday 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM

My recommendation to all the volunteers:

  • A firm commitment  to the event would be helpful
  • Wear comfortable clothes (Remember this is an outdoor event)
  • Bring work boots or sturdy old shoes
  • Bring a bottle of water
  • Dont hesitate to contact me for any additional information regarding this event.

You can contact Danielle Stehlik @716-961-8183 on the day of the event for any last minute schedule issues or cancellation due to inclement weather.

Thank you and please don't hesitate to contact me anytime @505-301-6872.

Phani

P.S. I will be bringing our Popular Boston Volunteers T-shirts with me. Grab one if you like, they are just $16.

The Boston Volunteers
Big Enough to Deliver, Small Enough to Care
Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org


Connect with your fellow Boston Volunteers
http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers
Discover exclusive Boston Volunteer opportunities:
https://twitter.com/#!/BostonVolunteer

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Daffodil Bulbs planting Event-The Charles River Conservancy
